December 26, 1920.

Classification: Parks

Union Square, at East 14th Street, and Broadway, northward, showing Union Square West (B'Way) on the left, and Union Square East (4th Ave.) on the right. Buildings observed across Union Square Park, are on the north side of East 17th Street. The Metropolitan tower appears across the skyline.

October 1924.

General Electric Company.
title: Manhattan: Union Square - 14th Street (East) - Broadway - [Union Square Park.]

text:
East 14th Street, south side, at Broadway, as photographed southwestward from Union Square East (4th Ave.) and 15th Street.  The ornate building at the S.W. corner was demolished and replaced with a modern office structure.  Adjoining same is the women's finishing house of Orbachs.  It remains after absorption of the adjacent building occupied by Abels.  Note the equestrian Washington statue at the left.  This was removed to a new site inside of the park.
January 30, 1928
P.L. Sperr

(1)
14th Street, south side, west from and including Broadway, to and including Fifth Ave. Also shown is Union Square West, west side, north from and including 14th, to and including 15 Streets, also shown is 15th Street, north side, west from and including Union Square West. The view includes the S.E. corner of Union Square, as shown in the foreground.
September 23, 1930

F.L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, showing a clear view.
October 30, 1928

F.L. Sperr.

(1)
peddlers - Refreshments - Pretzels: A pretzel vendor at Union Square. This shot was taken on the 14th Street side of same and shows a view eastward from Broadway (right).

May 1, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
Another pretzel vendor, on Union Square East and showing an extensive view northward on same. Individuals shown were marchers in the May Day Parade, which disbanded at this point.

May 1, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

title: Occupations - Peddlers - Food - Refreshments - Pretzels.

text: East 14th Street, south side, east from Broadway (right) to Fourth Avenue (left).  The Rogers Peet & Co. Bldg. shown, occupies the southerly half of this block, utilizing the 13th Street side.  June 15, 1938.  P.L. Sperr.
